hotel.name: DejaView Hostel , The Walk - JBR
hotel.reasonForSelection: Selected for its excellent 4.8-star rating from over 35 reviews, affordable price, and strategic location on The Walk - JBR, making it ideal for a family looking for value and accessibility to the beach and attractions.

places.name: Arrival at Dubai International Airport (DXB) & Hotel Check-in
places.description: Welcome to Dubai! After landing at Dubai International Airport (DXB), clear immigration, collect your luggage, and take a pre-booked taxi or ride-sharing service to your hotel. Settle into your room, freshen up, and take some time to relax and acclimate to the vibrant city.
places.whyVisit: The start of your exciting family adventure in Dubai. A smooth check-in process allows you to recharge after your flight and prepare for the amazing experiences ahead.

safetyNotes: Keep your valuables secure.
Use official airport taxis or reputable ride-sharing apps.

places.name: Dubai Fountain Show & Burj Khalifa (At The Top)
places.description: Witness the world's largest choreographed fountain system at the base of the Burj Khalifa. The Dubai Fountain shoots water up to 500 ft in the air, accompanied by a range of classical to contemporary music. Afterward, ascend the world's tallest building to the 'At The Top' observation decks on the 124th and 125th floors for breathtaking 360-degree views of the city's glittering skyline.
places.whyVisit: An iconic Dubai experience that combines a spectacular free show with the awe-inspiring feeling of being on top of the world. It offers an unparalleled perspective of the city's scale and ambition, which is fascinating for all ages.

safetyNotes: Hold on to railings on the observation deck.
Keep track of your belongings in crowded areas.
photoSpots: The observation deck against the city lights
In front of the Dubai Fountain during the show

dailyItinerary.optimizedRoute: Hotel → Ski Dubai → The Dubai Mall → Hotel

places.name: The Dubai Mall
places.description: Explore one of the planet's largest and most visited retail and entertainment destinations. The Dubai Mall is more than just a shopping center; it's a city within a city. It features over 1,200 retail stores, hundreds of food and beverage outlets, and world-class attractions for the whole family. The sheer scale and variety make it a must-visit.
places.whyVisit: It's an all-in-one destination. For a 13-year-old, the highlights are the Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo, the Olympic-sized Dubai Ice Rink, and the interactive KidZania. It's the perfect place to shop, dine, and be entertained under one roof.

whatToBring: A map of the mall or use the app
safetyNotes: Set a meeting point in case you get separated.
Stay hydrated.
photoSpots: The Human Waterfall
Outside the Dubai Aquarium tunnel

places.name: Ski Dubai (Mall of the Emirates)
places.description: Experience a winter wonderland in the middle of the desert at Ski Dubai, located in the Mall of the Emirates. This indoor ski resort maintains a temperature of -1 to 2 degrees Celsius and features an 85-meter-high indoor mountain with 5 slopes of varying steepness and difficulty. It's an surreal and unforgettable experience.
places.whyVisit: The novelty of playing in the snow in Dubai is a massive draw. You can go skiing, snowboarding, meet penguins, or simply enjoy the snow park. It's a fantastic and unique activity for a family looking for fun and a break from the heat.

whatToBuy: Hot chocolate at the Avalanche Café
safetyNotes: Listen to the instructors' safety briefings.
Wear the provided winter gear.
photoSpots: With the penguins
On the chairlift with the slopes in the background

dailyItinerary.optimizedRoute: Hotel → Atlantis, The Palm → JBR Walk → Hotel

places.name: Palm Jumeirah & Atlantis, The Palm
places.description: Explore the world-famous Palm Jumeirah, a magnificent man-made archipelago. At its apex sits the iconic Atlantis, The Palm resort. Spend the day at its Aquaventure Waterpark, home to record-breaking slides and a private beach, or delve into the myth of Atlantis at The Lost Chambers Aquarium, where you can see over 65,000 marine animals.
places.whyVisit: A perfect day out for a family with a teenager. Aquaventure offers thrilling water slides and river rides, while The Lost Chambers provides a more relaxed, educational experience. The sheer grandeur of the Palm and Atlantis is a sight to behold.

practicalInfo.bestTime: Arrive early to get good spots

safetyNotes: Follow all lifeguard instructions.
Stay hydrated throughout the day.
photoSpots: In front of the main Atlantis building
On the Leap of Faith slide (if you dare!)

places.name: Dubai Marina & JBR Walk
places.description: Experience the vibrant atmosphere of Dubai Marina and The Walk at Jumeirah Beach Residence (JBR). This waterfront district features a stunning skyline of twisting skyscrapers, a picturesque marina filled with yachts, and a bustling promenade. The Walk at JBR is a popular street lined with shops, cafes, and restaurants, perfect for an evening stroll.
places.whyVisit: It's a fantastic place to experience modern Dubai's lifestyle. You can enjoy a relaxing dhow cruise, dine with a view of the marina, or simply soak in the lively ambiance. The proximity to your hotel makes it an easy and enjoyable evening out.

safetyNotes: Be aware of your surroundings in crowded areas.
photoSpots: The Cayan Tower (twisting building)
With the yachts in the marina as a backdrop

places.name: Desert Safari with BBQ Dinner
places.description: Embark on an unforgettable Arabian adventure with a desert safari. This quintessential Dubai experience typically includes a thrilling 4x4 drive over sand dunes (dune bashing), followed by a visit to a traditional Bedouin-style campsite. Here, you can enjoy a host of cultural activities before settling down for a delicious barbecue dinner under the stars.
places.whyVisit: It's a perfect blend of adventure, culture, and entertainment. The excitement of dune bashing, the tranquility of a desert sunset, and the vibrant cultural performances make it a highlight for any family trip. It's a fantastic way to experience the natural beauty of the Arabian desert.

practicalInfo.accessibility: Limited; depends on the tour operator

whatToBring: A light sweater for the evening
safetyNotes: Dune bashing can be bumpy; not recommended for those with back problems.
Follow the guide's instructions at all times.
photoSpots: Sunset over the dunes
Riding a camel
The traditional campsite

dailyItinerary.optimizedRoute: Hotel → Al Fahidi Historical Neighbourhood → Global Village → Hotel

places.name: Old Dubai Exploration (Al Fahidi & Souks)
places.description: Step back in time in Old Dubai. Wander through the maze-like alleys of the Al Fahidi Historical Neighbourhood, with its traditional wind-tower architecture. Visit the Dubai Museum, housed in the city's oldest existing building, to learn about Dubai's transformation. Then, take a traditional 'Abra' (water taxi) across Dubai Creek to explore the bustling Gold, Spice, and Textile Souks.
places.whyVisit: It offers a stark contrast to modern Dubai and provides a fascinating glimpse into the city's heritage. The sensory experience of the souks and the authentic atmosphere of the creek are culturally enriching for both adults and teenagers.

safetyNotes: Be prepared to haggle respectfully in the souks.
Be mindful of your belongings.
photoSpots: The wind towers in Al Fahidi
On the Abra with the old city in the background
The vibrant displays in the Spice Souk

places.name: Global Village
places.description: Experience the world in one place at Global Village, a massive seasonal multicultural festival park. It features pavilions representing over 90 countries, where you can shop for authentic products, watch cultural performances, and sample international cuisines. The park also has a large funfair with rides and games for all ages.
places.whyVisit: It's a vibrant, high-energy destination that's incredibly fun for families. The combination of shopping, food, live shows, and amusement park rides ensures there's something to entertain everyone. A great way to spend an evening.

whatToBring: A jacket as it can get cool in the evening
safetyNotes: The park is huge, so plan your visit.
Stay together as it can get very crowded.
photoSpots: In front of the beautifully designed pavilions
The main stage during a performance

dailyItinerary.optimizedRoute: Hotel → IMG Worlds of Adventure → Hotel

places.name: IMG Worlds of Adventure
places.description: Spend a full day at IMG Worlds of Adventure, the world's largest indoor theme park. The park is divided into five 'epic zones', including Marvel, Cartoon Network, and The Lost Valley - Dinosaur Adventure. With adrenaline-pumping roller coasters, thrilling rides, and attractions based on popular characters, it's a paradise for thrill-seekers and families.
places.whyVisit: Being entirely indoors, it's the perfect all-day attraction regardless of the weather. It caters perfectly to a 13-year-old's interests with its mix of superheroes and dinosaurs, while also offering plenty of excitement for adults. A guaranteed day of fun and adventure.

whatToBring: A portable charger for your phone
safetyNotes: Adhere to height and safety restrictions for all rides.
Pace yourselves and take breaks.
photoSpots: With Marvel superheroes
Next to the life-sized dinosaurs in The Lost Valley

places.name: Leisurely Breakfast & Last-Minute Souvenir Shopping
places.description: Enjoy a final, relaxed breakfast in Dubai. Depending on your flight schedule, you can do some last-minute souvenir shopping at a nearby mall or local market. Pack your bags and complete the check-out process at your hotel.
places.whyVisit: A calm and organized start to your departure day ensures a stress-free end to your vacation. It's the perfect time to reflect on the wonderful memories you've made as a family.

safetyNotes: Double-check your room for any forgotten items before checking out.

places.name: Departure from Dubai International Airport (DXB)
places.description: Head to Dubai International Airport (DXB) for your flight home. It is recommended to arrive at the airport at least 3 hours before your international flight's departure time. Complete your airline check-in and security procedures, leaving you with fond memories of your Dubai family adventure.
places.whyVisit: The culmination of your journey, sending you home with a treasure trove of experiences and stories to share.

safetyNotes: Keep an eye on your luggage and travel documents at all times.

budgetTips: Use the Dubai Metro for longer distances to save on taxi fares.
Look for 'lunch special' deals at restaurants, which are often cheaper than dinner.
Take advantage of free attractions like the Dubai Fountain show and exploring the souks.
Book tickets for major attractions online in advance to get better prices and avoid queues.

clothing: Long-sleeved shirts and long pants for sun protection
A modest outfit for visiting cultural sites (covering shoulders and knees)
A light jacket or sweater for cool indoor spaces and desert evenings
medication: Basic first-aid kit (band-aids, pain relievers, antiseptic wipes)
documents: Copies of important documents (digital and physical)

preTripChecklist.task: Apply for UAE visas for all travelers
Book tickets for major attractions (Burj Khalifa, Theme Parks, Desert Safari)
Exchange currency or inform your bank of your travel plans
